name: nsa_topk_indexer_h16_ckv512_kpe64_topk256_ps1
description: Native Sparse Attention (NSA) TopK indexer for DeepSeek-V3.2. Computes sparse attention scores and selects top-K KV cache indices for each query token.

num_index_heads.description: Number of indexer heads (typically matches query heads).

topk.description: Number of top-K indices to select.

num_pages.description: Total number of allocated pages in the KV cache.

k_index_cache.description: Key index cache for sparse attention scoring.

seq_lens.description: Sequence lengths for each batch element.

page_table.description: Page table mapping sequence positions to KV cache pages.

topk_indices.description: Top-K page indices for each batch element. Values of -1 indicate padding.

topk_scores.description: Attention scores for the selected top-K indices.

reference:
import torch


@torch.no_grad()
def run(q_index, k_index_cache, seq_lens, page_table):
    batch_size, num_index_heads, index_head_dim = q_index.shape
    topk = 256

    # Check constants
    assert num_index_heads == 16
    assert index_head_dim == 64

    device = q_index.device

    # Squeeze page dimension (page_size=1)
    K_all = k_index_cache.squeeze(1).to(torch.float32)  # [num_pages, index_head_dim]

    topk_indices = torch.full((batch_size, topk), -1, dtype=torch.int32, device=device)
    topk_scores = torch.full((batch_size, topk), -float("inf"), dtype=torch.float32, device=device)

    for b in range(batch_size):
        seq_len = int(seq_lens[b].item())
        
        if seq_len == 0:
            continue

        # Get page indices for this sequence
        pages = page_table[b, :seq_len].to(torch.long)  # [seq_len]
        K = K_all[pages]  # [seq_len, index_head_dim]
        
        # Query for this batch element
        q = q_index[b].to(torch.float32)  # [num_index_heads, index_head_dim]
        
        # Compute attention scores
        scores = q @ K.T  # [num_index_heads, seq_len]
        
        # Average across heads for TopK selection
        avg_scores = scores.mean(dim=0)  # [seq_len]
        
        # Select top-K
        actual_topk = min(topk, seq_len)
        topk_vals, topk_idx = torch.topk(avg_scores, actual_topk)
        
        # Convert local indices to page indices
        topk_pages = pages[topk_idx]  # [actual_topk]
        
        topk_indices[b, :actual_topk] = topk_pages.to(torch.int32)
        topk_scores[b, :actual_topk] = topk_vals

    return topk_indices, topk_scores
